feedback.Physical object: Included — The radar system is a tangible installation composed of hardware like antennas, rotors, and enclosures.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Included — Fully engineered and constructed by humans for signal detection and tracking.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — It does not mimic or derive from biological forms or functions.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Typically mounted at permanent or semi-permanent locations like airports or control stations.
feedback.Structural: Included — Function depends on mechanical structure (e.g., parabolic dish or phased array orientation).
feedback.Perceptible: Included — The radar array and support structures are visible to observers.
feedback.Material form: Included — Constructed from physical materials like steel, composite, and electrical components.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — It actively transmits radio signals and processes returns.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Specifically designed to monitor and guide aircraft through detection and tracking.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Included — Emits electromagnetic pulses and outputs data to controllers and systems.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Included — Interprets echoes using signal-processing algorithms and tracking software.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Included — Continuously updates aircraft positions, headings, and tracking metadata.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Operated by humans but not interacted with directly by general users (e.g., pilots, passengers).
feedback.Part of a larger system: Included — Integrated into national and international air traffic control infrastructure.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — Typically requires operator oversight and control.
feedback.System-critical: Included — A foundational component of aviation safety and airspace coordination.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — It does not represent ideas or concepts symbolically.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — It sends signals, but not for abstract or symbolic communication.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Included — Operates under strict signal-processing rules and tracking logic.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — While built from subsystems, it is not semantically modular in identity.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — Provides input to guide decisions but does not prescribe behavior itself.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — Does not model itself or operate at a meta-conceptual level.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Timing is essential to its operation (e.g., pulse repetition intervals, Doppler shifts).
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Operates in fixed physical/logical contexts, not cultural or interpretive ones.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Its function is technical and regulatory, not socially symbolic.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Standardized, but not defined in its identity by group membership.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Does not inherently define or carry personal or group identity.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Included — Operation is strictly governed by aviation and communications authorities.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — It is not itself a teaching device or educational artifact.
feedback.Visible: Excluded — The structure is visible, but its function and semantics are not inherently visible.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Operates based on signal logic, not social or semantic context.
feedback.Widely known: Included — The concept of 'radar' is broadly recognized across technical and public domains.

encoding_notes: Air Traffic Control Radar is encoded as a regulated, fixed-location signal system that emits, processes, and updates tracking data in real-time. It is part of a broader aviation safety infrastructure, uses formal timing logic, and is widely known but not symbolic or identity-linked. Autonomous and communicative traits are excluded due to operator control and lack of symbolic expression. Final UHT code DEF52211 correctly includes regulated and known status in the social layer.
